realm-settings.deleteConfirm: If you delete this realm, all associated data will be removed.
realm-settings.disableConfirm: User and clients can't access the realm if it's disabled. Are you sure you want to continue?
realm-settings.userRegistrationHelpText: Enable/disable the registration page. A link for registration will show on login page too.
realm-settings.forgotPasswordHelpText: Show a link on login page for user to click when they have forgotten their credentials.
realm-settings.rememberMeHelpText: Show checkbox on login page to allow user to remain logged in between browser restarts until session expires.
realm-settings.emailAsUsernameHelpText: Allow users to set email as username.
realm-settings.loginWithEmailHelpText: Allow users to log in with their email address.
realm-settings.duplicateEmailsHelpText: Allow multiple users to have the same email address. Changing this setting will also clear the user's cache. It is recommended to manually update email constraints of existing users in the database after switching off support for duplicate email addresses.
realm-settings.verifyEmailHelpText: Require user to verify their email address after initial login or after address changes are submitted.

partial-import.partialImportHeaderText: Partial import allows you to import users, clients, and resources from a previously exported json file.
